briefdescription.para: Compile time constant representing what kind of schema this class is.
Construct a PhysxSchemaPhysxCameraFollowLookAPI on UsdPrim prim .

detaileddescription.para: Equivalent to PhysxSchemaPhysxCameraFollowLookAPI::Get(prim.GetStage(), prim.GetPath()) for a valid prim, but will not immediately throw an error for an invalid prim

briefdescription.para: Construct a PhysxSchemaPhysxCameraFollowLookAPI on the prim held by schemaObj .

detaileddescription.para: Should be preferred over PhysxSchemaPhysxCameraFollowLookAPI(schemaObj.GetPrim()), as it preserves SchemaBase state.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
The minimum pitch angle of the terrain used for a linear interpolation to adjust the pitch of the camera.

detaileddescription.para: e.g. -45.0 degrees

briefdescription.para: See GetDownHillGroundAngleAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The minimum pitch angle of the camera used for a linear interpolation to adjust the pitch of the camera.

detaileddescription.para: e.g. 10.0 degrees

briefdescription.para: See GetDownHillGroundPitchAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The maximum pitch angle of the terrain used for a linear interpolation to adjust the pitch of the camera.

detaileddescription.para: e.g. 45.0 degrees

briefdescription.para: See GetUpHillGroundAngleAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The maximum pitch angle of the camera used for a linear interpolation to adjust the pitch of the camera.

detaileddescription.para: e.g. 10.0 degrees

briefdescription.para: See GetUpHillGroundPitchAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Filter time constant to blend between the look and velocity vectors, in seconds.

detaileddescription.para: e.g. 0.1 seconds

briefdescription.para: See GetVelocityBlendTimeConstantAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The positive, maximum speed, when driving in reverse, used for a linear interpolation to compute the follow distance of the camera.

detaileddescription.para: e.g. 1500.0 cm/sec

briefdescription.para: See GetFollowReverseSpeedAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The maximum distance, when driving in reverse, used for a linear interpolation to compute the follow distance of the camera.
See GetFollowReverseDistanceAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Return a vector of names of all pre-declared attributes for this schema class and all its ancestor classes.

detaileddescription.para: Does not include attributes that may be authored by custom/extended methods of the schemas involved.

briefdescription.para: Return a PhysxSchemaPhysxCameraFollowLookAPI holding the prim adhering to this schema at path on stage.

detaileddescription.para: If no prim exists at path on stage, or if the prim at that path does not adhere to this schema, return an invalid schema object. This is shorthand for the following:

briefdescription.para: Applies this single-apply API schema to the given prim.

detaileddescription.para: This information is stored by adding "PhysxCameraFollowLookAPI" to the token-valued, listOp metadata apiSchemas on the prim.

simplesect.para: A valid PhysxSchemaPhysxCameraFollowLookAPI object is returned upon success. An invalid (or empty) PhysxSchemaPhysxCameraFollowLookAPI object is returned upon failure. See UsdPrim::ApplyAPI() for conditions resulting in failure.

briefdescription.para: Returns the type of schema this class belongs to.
PhysX camera that follows behind the subject's forward vector as it moves.

detaileddescription.para: Assumes the subject is always upright and does not roll.
